Ira furor brevis est. - 'Wrath is but a: Igitur qui desiderat pacem, praeparet bellum. - 'Therefore let him who desires peace get ready for war.'
Aliis si licet, tibi non licet. - 'To others it is permitted, to you it is not permitted'
Acta Non Verba. - 'Actions instead of words'
Male parta male dilabuntur - 'What has been wrongly gained is wrongly lost.'
Fortes fortuna adiuvat. - 'Luck is with the bravest.'
Omnes una manet nox - 'One night awaits everyone.'
Quis, Quid, Ubi, Quibus Auxiliis, Cur, Quomodo, Quando? - 'Who, what, where, with what, why, how, when?'
In vino veritas. - 'Truth lies in wine'
Exitus Acta Probat – ‘The result justifies the deed.’
